result.markdown: --- title: "Why do people rebel? Grievances" menu: assignment: parent: Assignments weight: 3 --- ## Instructions - For the data, right-click, "save/download file as..." - Open the data - Complete all of the tasks associated with that data and keep track of your answers / images - **Once you are done**, go on Canvas and answer the questions related to the assignment - the Canvas assignment is **timed**; if you open it prior to completing the tasks you will run out of time Skills used: - filtering data - counting categories, percents - summary statistics - grouped summary, statistic [My awkward Google Sheets video tutorials are here](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/rsj9qm67se619pm/AAD1wPt84O8yaIfSPcwN9edua?dl=0) ::: {.callout-warning} You must complete all of the tasks here BEFORE opening the Canvas quiz; otherwise, you will run out of time! ::: ## Task 1: Manifestos Pick two manifestos from the list below and skim them. The manifestos themselves can be found at [this link](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/648s8i2itdjfriy/AACZrJxTdwPXFMDTkya6Gb_La?dl=0). Please note some of these contain extremely offensive content. The people/groups included are: - Rumiyah, the [ISIS magazine](https://www.jstor.org/stable/resrep37748#metadata_info_tab_contents) - The [New Irish Republican Army](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Irish_Republican_Army) - [Osama bin Laden](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osama_bin_Laden) "Letter to America" - [South Carolina terrorist, Dylann Roof](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dylann_Roof) - Manifesto of the [Christchurch mosque terrorist attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christchurch_mosque_shootings) - Manifesto of the [2019 el Paso, Walmart terrorist attack](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019_El_Paso_shooting) - Elliot Rodger, the "incel" [manifesto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2014_Isla_Vista_killings) - Eco-extremist group in Mexico, [Individualistas Tendiendo a lo Salvaje](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Individualists_Tending_to_the_Wild) 1. In two paragraphs, describe the following. How would you say these groups/people motivate and explain their actions? Do the two manifestos you picked do so similarly or in different ways? Include at least two quotes as examples. (5 points) ## Task 2: Ethnic power relations You're going to work with data from the Ethnic Power Relations (EPR) dataset. The dataset contains information on politically relevant ethnic groups around the world for a select period of time. - The data: [EPR dataset](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/6kkbuz25u8redtq5tr82h/EPR-2021.csv?rlkey=le25pido52duo8wcp3n74yiwz&dl=1) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} -------------------------------------------- Variable Description ----------- -------------------------------- statename Country from Starting year for time period to Ending year for time period group Name of ethnic group size Group size as a % of total population in that time period status Access to state power in that time period reg_aut Does group have regional autonomy in this period? -------------------------------------------- ::: ::: {.callout-note} These are the relevant variables in the dataset, the other ones you can ignore ::: ## Questions Using the dataset, answer the following questions: 2. Count the number of rows by `status`. What PERCENT of rows across the whole dataset are categorized as "powerless"? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 3. Look through some of the groups that are categorized as "powerless" in the dataset. In your opinion, is being a group that is "powerless" enough to generate grievances? Or can a group be "powerless" and not be aggrieved? (2 points) 4. Filter the data so you are only looking at Iraq between 1990 and 2003. What `size` (as a PERCENT) was the most powerful ethnic group in this country during this period? (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: 5. Calculate the average ethnic group size, broken down by whether or not the group has regional autonomy. About how much smaller, on average, are groups with regional autonomy than groups without? Report as a **percent point** difference (e.g., 20% - 15% = 5%). (1 point) ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} :::
